bugtrap03.bugdomain

Class Project

  • java.lang.Object
    • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notification.Subject
      • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notification.AbstractSystemSubject
        • bugtrap03.bugdomain.AbstractSystem
          • bugtrap03.bugdomain.Project

  • public class Project
extends AbstractSystem
    This class extends AbstractSystem (versionID, name and description) and extends it with dates.
    Author:
    Kwinten Buytaert & Ben Goethuys

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      • Project

        public Project(VersionID version,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.util.GregorianCalendar creationDate,
               Developer lead,
               java.util.GregorianCalendar startDate,
               long budgetEstimate)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a project with a given versionID, name, description, creationDate, lead, startDate, budgetEstimate.
        Parameters:
        version - The versionID of this project.
        name - The name of this project.
        description - The description of this project.
        creationDate - The creation date of this project.
        lead - The lead developer of this project
        startDate - The start date of this project. This will be cloned.
        budgetEstimate - The budget estimate of this project
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is invalid
        See Also:
        AbstractSystem.AbstractSystem(AbstractSystem, VersionID, String, String), isValidCreationDate(GregorianCalendar), isValidLead(Developer), isValidStartDate(GregorianCalendar, GregorianCalendar), isValidBudgetEstimate(long)

                                       java.util.GregorianCalendar startDate)
        This method checks the validity of the start date.
        Parameters:
        creationDate - The creation date.
        startDate - The start date.
        Returns:
        True if creation date <= start date.

      • isValidBudgetEstimate

        public static boolean isValidBudgetEstimate(long budgetEstimate)
        Checks the validity of the given budgetEstimate. The value must be positive (or zero)
        Parameters:
        budgetEstimate - The budget estimate to check of type long
        Returns:
        false if budgetEstimate is smaller than zero

      • getParent

      • setRole

        public boolean setRole(User user,
                       Developer dev,
                       Role role)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       PermissionException
        The given user uses this method to set the role of a given developer to the given role
        Parameters:
        user - The user that wants to set the given role to the given developer
        dev - The developer to give the new role to
        role - The role that will be assigned to the given developer
        Returns:
        Whether the roles of the developer have changed.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - If the given user does not have sufficient permissions to assign the given role to the given developer
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When user == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When developer == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When role == null

      • deleteRole

        public boolean deleteRole(Developer dev,
                          Role role)
        Remove the role from the developer for this project.
        Caution: Only use when you can guarantee no constraints are effected. (e.g This does change anything about BugReports with the developer as 'assigned'.)
        This is used for undoing an 'assign role' directly after assigning that role.
        Parameters:
        dev - The developer to delete the role off.
        role - The role to remove
        Returns:
        Whether the roles of the developer have changed. False when dev == null || role == null.

      • getDetails

        public java.lang.String getDetails()
        Get the Project details in string format so it is nice to print out. (Includes Project name, description, version ID, budgetEstimate, startDate, Lead, creationDate)
        Specified by:
        getDetails in class AbstractSystem
        Returns:
        A string with on each line an attribute of the Project: name, description, versionID, budget estimate, start date, lead developer and creation date

      • cloneProject

        public Project cloneProject(VersionID version,
                            Developer lead,
                            java.util.GregorianCalendar startDate,
                            long budgetEstimate)
        Performs a deep clone on this Project. excluding all bugReports.
        Parameters:
        version - The versionID of this project.
        lead - The lead developer of this project
        startDate - The start date of this project.
        budgetEstimate - The budget estimate of this project
        Returns:
        The deep-cloned project.
        See Also:
        Subsystem.cloneSubsystem(AbstractSystem)
